aboutpara: Hello! I'm Joshua Ledda, a web developer with a BS in Information Systems, majoring in Service Management Program. I am passionate about creating dynamic web applications, especially with Tailwind, JavaScript, and Laravel. I'm also an aspiring cybersecurity analyst, aiming to deepen my knowledge and skills in securing websites and solving cyber-related challenges

resume.tagline: I'm a web developer and an aspiring cyber security analyst.
resume.description: Detail-oriented entry-level developer passionate about web development and aspiring to cybersecurity. Committed to creating efficient, user-friendly solutions. Quick learner dedicated to continuous improvement and eager to contribute to innovative projects.

experiences.bullets: Worked on different websites, Collaborated and created systems with other interns.

education.universityName: Don Mariano Marcos Memorial State University - North La Union Campus

training.activities: Finish 133+ assignments 2 exams and 1 capstone. | Able to create own libraries, query builder and MVC Framework from scratch.
Participated and engaged in the Ai Prompt Engineering Training | Participated and engaged in Advanced UI/UX Concepts Training | Participated and engaged in Web Fundamental Training

training.companyName: PICSProfessionals Philippine Institute of Cyber Security Professionals Training
training.activities: Participated and engagedd in training at Antarex Blue SOC Analyst. | Participated and engaged in training at Basic Vulnerability Assesment and Management | Participated and engaged training at GRC: Operational and Tactical Levels | Participated and engaged training at ESET Cybersecurity Awareness and ESET Protect Training

award.awardName: Proficient in Web Fundamentals (Village 88 Inc., Feb 2024)
award.description: Passed the exam in cloning a landing page of Abenson website using HTML and CSS only under 4 hours limit.
Passed the exam by coding both the front and back end of a given wireframe using Bootstrap, jQuery, Ajax, MySQL, and CodeIgniter within an 8-hour time limit.

award.awardName: Test of Practical Competency in IT (TOPCIT) Passer
award.description: Passed the  Test Of Practical Competency in IT (TOPCIT) examination in November 2023.
Completed all the requirments to qualify as a Certified Antarex SOC Analyst.

project.projectDescription: The front-end and back-end were developed using Bootstrap, jQuery, PHP CodeIgniter, and MySQL in just 7 days. The application features an admin dashboard, product catalogs, detaile. Additionally, the app design includes an Entity-Relationship Diagram (ERD), security measures, and session management.

The front-end and back-end were developed using Tailwind CSS, PHP Laravel, Laravel Livewire, and jQuery in just one month. Features include admin and staff dashboards, user, referral, and student management, referral submission and tracking, notifications, intervention tracking, reporting, audit trail, and student profiles. The app design also includes security measures, and session management.
